ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned that art is what I make it to be. Did not learn many techniques from my professor, but we studied the techniques of artists.
Painting techniques, watercolor history and artists
I learned a lot about watercolor and famous watercolorists, and I became better at painting.
It was really fun and informative!

I learned many different basic and historical techniques for painting with watercolor, how to interpret style and method from completed paintings, and how to dedicate my free time to a fun and fulfilling hobby.
History and method of watercolor painting

I learned how to control water, manipulate the brush, and detect unexpected beauty in the form, light, shadow, and depiction of the natural world. was exposed to so many masters of watercolor, and it thoroughly transformed my ability to create art and come up with my own styles and work
I was able to develop my watercolor skills, painting analysis and discussion.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
It allows for creative freedom. 
However, it would be nice if we actually workshopped different techniques for those who are truly new to painting. I enjoyed my independent practice but would have appreciated some more in-depth lessons about how to create certain effects in my work.

This is a great class. It was challenging over zoom, but the overall format of painting a lot every week and learning about watercolor artists is well-conceived. In a normal year, it would be an absolute delight!

The majority of the weaknesses of the course are truly only due to the virtual format. I would have appreciated more specific pointers on my paintings-in-progress during class and office hours, but such a specific level of feedback is impossible when the Professor Van Doren could not physically be with us while we were painting to observe technique, and showing pieces on camera over zoom led to far more misinterpretation than anything else. One thing that future students could find valuable moving forward would be for Professor Van Doren to keep a running list of 3-5 students per week to summon to office hours, to ensure that everyone is attending regularly or semi-regularly, because I think it was easy for some people to allow this course to fall by the wayside while taking other (more demanding) courses.

One weakness moving forward that it would be excellent to improve upon would be to do more of a "this is basic watercolor technique" in the first/second classes. Not just "look at how this artist does it" but something as elementary as "this is how you hold a brush, this is how you apply the water to the paper, this is how you apply the pigment to the paper, this is how you fill your palette"
Great class, very much a class about what it is supposed to be about. Never felt like "why am I doing this?" or "I didn't sign up for this." Kinda fun, too.

the variety and diversity of artists covered was electrifying. I never expected to be exposed to so much and so many styles. From the way they used color, light, shadow, and the brush, to even the way they *saw*, I learned so much from this portfolio of watercolor masters. I loved Prof van doren's style of teaching. he's so witty, fun, and patient. He never is harsh and he always encourages you to explore and try the weirdest things. this is the best way to learn. Even if you're used to painting and drawing, like myself, his teaching style opens you up to new avenues of exploration

This class was nothing but strengths. The professor was always available to meet with students, always gave helpful suggestions and critique, and provided the space for us to develop our own creativity and skills.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The zoom classes were a little difficult, since watercolor is a hard thing to teach online. I think this class will be much better when it can be taught in person again.

Showing works over zoom camera for critique: I truly think critiques should have happened in office hours only, and then students would have the opportunity to upload a scanned or photograph copy of their work, which would give Professor Van Doren a better sense at what he was assessing. Sometimes it was clear that the image quality from the zoom camera meant the Professor was seeing something incorrectly.
Meeting outside to paint was a joy!
Prof Van doren did his very best and I'm so grateful for his care and attentiveness through the screen! its hard to see color and brushstrokes through zoom but he made it work!

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! if nothing else, try something new. Tap into your artistic side. You may find a new mode of expression like I did.

Yes! This is one of those "liberal arts" classes that you should take before graduating. As a complete beginner, I've learned lots about painting and have made some paintings that I would not think was possible before taking this course. The professor is also super nice and helpful. Would definitely recommend!
This is a wonderful class! It was a little hard on zoom, but in person I think it'd be just delightful. Professor Van Doren is so kind and knowledgeable.
Yes. It is an incredibly fun introduction to an art form that is highly accessible.

yes, absolutely. I've often lamented how yale courses focus on developing a knowledgeable or familiarity with concepts to the exclusion of personal growth. This class is one of very few offered by yale where students come away thinking, "I can..." or "I experienced..." in addition to "I know..." or "I think."

This was a fabulous and enriching course. I learned so much about myself through the process of making off-the-cuff artistic decisions, of picking up the brush every week and just painting without as much planning as I'm used to in my oil paints. I learned to be more discerning with my details and artistic choices because of the nature of the medium. Watercolor is ultimately about confidence, and panache. I am a better person, seer, thinker, because I took this class.
I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS CLASS TO ANOTHER STUDENT!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Occasional in person meeting to paint outdoors
We met on zoom, and once in person at the end of the semester.

Virtual seminar or other discussion format
In-person seminar or other discussion format
Periodic outdoor gathering
We had one in-person meeting which was thrilling!
Sometimes we would meet outdoors!
